intro: Astragalus ovalifoliolatus, commonly known as the oval-leaf milkvetch, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves with oval-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers arranged in spikes, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Due to its medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated for its potential health benefits.
